name: Curcumin
description: Yellow-orange coloring from turmeric. Approved in EU and USA. No known health effects.

name: Riboflavin (Vitamin B2)
description: Yellow-orange coloring, formerly called lactoflavin. Approved in EU and USA. No known health effects.

name: Riboflavin-5'-phosphate
description: Yellow-orange coloring. Approved in EU. No known health effects.

name: Tartrazine (FD&C Yellow 5)
description: Yellow dye. Approved in EU and USA. May cause hyperactivity in children and allergies.

name: Alkanet
description: Red-brown coloring. Not widely documented. No known health effects.

name: Quinoline Yellow WS
description: Dull or greenish-yellow coloring. Limited use approved in EU. No known health effects.

name: Fast Yellow AB
description: Yellow dye. Banned in EU and USA. No known health effects.

name: Riboflavin-5-Sodium Phosphate
description: Yellow coloring. No documentation. No known health effects.

name: Yellow 2G
description: Yellow dye. No documentation. No known health effects.

name: Sunset Yellow FCF (FD&C Yellow 6)
description: Yellow-orange dye. Limited use in EU; banned in Norway; requires warnings in EU; approved in USA. May cause hyperactivity in children.

name: Orange GGN
description: Orange dye. No documentation. No known health effects.

name: Cochineal, Carminic Acid, Carmine
description: Scarlet coloring from insects. Approved in EU and USA. No known health effects.

name: Citrus Red 2
description: Orange to pink dye. Approved in USA only for coloring orange peels. No known health effects.

name: Carmoisine (Azorubine)
description: Red to maroon dye. Approved in EU; voluntary phasing out in UK; banned in Canada, Japan, Norway, USA. May cause hyperactivity in children.

name: Amaranth (FD&C Red 2)
description: Red dye. Approved in EU; banned in USA. No known health effects.

name: Ponceau 4R (Cochineal Red A)
description: Pink dye. Limited use approved in EU. May cause hyperactivity in children.

name: Ponceau SX, Scarlet GN
description: Red dye. Allowed only for external medicines and cosmetics in USA. No known health effects.

name: Ponceau 6R
description: Red dye. No documentation. No known health effects.

name: Erythrosine (FD&C Red 3)
description: Pink dye. Approved in EU; banned in USA. No known health effects.

name: Red 2G
description: Red or pink dye. Not approved in EU. No known health effects.

name: Allura Red AC (FD&C Red 40)
description: Red dye. Approved in EU but banned in some member states; banned in Norway and Switzerland; voluntary phasing out in UK; approved in USA. May cause hyperactivity in children.

name: Indanthrene Blue RS
description: Blue dye. No documentation. No known health effects.

name: Patent Blue V
description: Sky blue dye. Approved in EU; banned in USA and Australia. No known health effects.

name: Indigotin (Indigo Carmine)
description: Indigo dye. Approved in EU and USA. No known health effects.

name: Brilliant Blue FCF (FD&C Blue 1)
description: Blue dye. Approved in EU and USA. No known health effects.

name: Chlorophylls and Chlorophyllins
description: Green coloring. Approved in EU. No known health effects.

name: Copper Complexes of Chlorophylls
description: Green coloring. Approved in EU and USA. No known health effects.

name: Green S
description: Green dye. Approved in EU. No known health effects.

name: Fast Green FCF (FD&C Green 3)
description: Turquoise dye. Approved in USA; banned in EU. No known health effects.

name: Plain Caramel
description: Brown coloring. Approved in EU and USA. No known health effects.

name: Caustic Sulfite Caramel
description: Brown coloring. Approved in EU and USA. No known health effects.

name: Ammonia Caramel
description: Brown coloring. Approved in EU and USA. No known health effects.

name: Sulfite Ammonia Caramel
description: Brown coloring. Approved in EU and USA. No known health effects.

name: Black PN, Brilliant Black BN
description: Black dye. Approved in EU. No known health effects.

name: Carbon Black
description: Black dye. No documentation. No known health effects.

name: Vegetable Carbon
description: Black coloring. Approved in EU; banned in USA. No known health effects.

name: Brown FK (Kipper Brown)
description: Brown dye. Previously approved in EU only for coloring kippers; approval withdrawn November 2011. No known health effects.

name: Brown HT (Chocolate Brown HT)
description: Brown dye. Approved in EU. No known health effects.

name: Carotenes (Alpha, Beta, Gamma)
description: Yellow-orange to brown coloring. Approved in EU; only beta-carotene approved in USA. No known health effects.

name: Annatto, Bixin, Norbixin
description: Orange coloring. Approved in EU and USA. No known health effects.

name: Paprika Oleoresin
description: Red coloring. Approved in EU and USA. No known health effects.

name: Lycopene
description: Light to deep red coloring. Limited use approved in EU; approved in USA. No known health effects.

name: Beta-apo-8'-carotenal (C 30)
description: Orange-red to yellow coloring. Approved in EU and USA. No known health effects.

name: Ethyl Ester of Beta-apo-8'-carotenic Acid
description: Orange-red to yellow coloring. Not approved in EU. No known health effects.

name: Flavoxanthin
description: Golden-yellow and brown coloring. No documentation. No known health effects.

name: Lutein
description: Orange-red to yellow coloring. Approved in EU. No known health effects.

description: Deep purple coloring. No documentation. No known health effects.

name: Astaxanthin

description: Red coloring. Approved in EU and USA. No known health effects.

name: Anthocyanins

name: Saffron
description: Orange-red coloring. Approved in USA. No known health effects.

name: Calcium Carbonate

name: Iron Oxides and Hydroxides

name: Ascorbic Acid (Vitamin C)
description: Antioxidant. Approved in EU and USA; no safety concerns at reported uses. No safety concerns; no numerical ADI needed.
whereFound: Juices, meat, bakery products, processed foods

name: Calcium Ascorbate
description: Calcium salt of Vitamin C. Antioxidant. Generally safe.

name: Tocopherols (Vitamin E)
description: Vitamin E. Natural antioxidant. Safe for consumption.

name: Alpha-Tocopherol
description: Form of Vitamin E. Natural antioxidant. Safe for consumption.

name: Gamma-Tocopherol
description: Form of Vitamin E. Natural antioxidant. Safe for consumption.

name: Delta-Tocopherol
description: Form of Vitamin E. Natural antioxidant. Safe for consumption.

name: Propyl Gallate
description: Synthetic antioxidant. May cause stomach irritation in some people.

name: Octyl Gallate
description: Synthetic antioxidant. May cause allergic reactions in some people.

name: Dodecyl Gallate
description: Synthetic antioxidant. May cause allergic reactions in some people.

name: BHA
description: Butylated Hydroxyanisole. Synthetic antioxidant. Possible carcinogen in high doses.

name: BHT
description: Butylated Hydroxytoluene. Synthetic antioxidant. May cause allergic reactions.

name: Lecithins
description: Natural emulsifier from soybeans or eggs. Generally safe.

name: Citric Acid
description: Natural acid found in citrus fruits. Generally safe.

name: Sodium Citrates
description: Sodium salts of citric acid. Generally safe.

name: Potassium Citrates
description: Potassium salts of citric acid. Generally safe.

name: Calcium Citrates
description: Calcium salts of citric acid. Generally safe.

name: Alginic Acid
description: Natural thickener from seaweed. Generally safe.

name: Sodium Alginate
description: Natural thickener from seaweed. Generally safe.

name: Potassium Alginate
description: Natural thickener from seaweed. Generally safe.

name: Ammonium Alginate
description: Natural thickener from seaweed. Generally safe.

name: Calcium Alginate
description: Natural thickener from seaweed. Generally safe.

name: Agar
description: Natural gelling agent from red seaweed. Safe for consumption.

name: Carrageenan
description: Thickener from red seaweed. May cause digestive issues in some people.

name: Locust Bean Gum
description: Natural thickener from carob tree seeds. Generally safe.

name: Guar Gum
description: Natural thickener from guar beans. Generally safe.

name: Tragacanth
description: Natural thickener from plant sap. Generally safe.

name: Gum Arabic
description: Natural thickener from acacia tree sap. Generally safe.

name: Xanthan Gum
description: Natural thickener. Generally safe for consumption.

name: Sorbitol
description: Natural sugar alcohol. May have laxative effect in large amounts.

name: Mannitol
description: Natural sugar alcohol. May have laxative effect in large amounts.

name: Glycerol
description: Natural sweetener and preservative. Generally safe.

name: Pectins
description: Natural thickener from fruits. Safe for consumption.

name: Diphosphates
description: Phosphate salts. May interfere with calcium absorption in high amounts.

name: Triphosphates
description: Phosphate salts. May interfere with calcium absorption in high amounts.

name: Polyphosphates
description: Phosphate salts. May interfere with calcium absorption in high amounts.

name: Sodium Carbonates
description: Baking soda and related compounds. Generally safe.

name: Potassium Carbonates
description: Potassium salts. Generally safe in food amounts.

name: Ammonium Carbonates
description: Used in baking. Generally safe in food amounts.

name: Hydrochloric Acid
description: Strong acid used to adjust pH. Safe in small amounts used in food.

name: Potassium Chloride
description: Salt substitute. Generally safe for most people.

name: Calcium Chloride
description: Firming agent and salt. Generally safe.

name: Acesulfame K
description: Artificial sweetener. 200 times sweeter than sugar.

name: Aspartame
description: Artificial sweetener. Contains phenylalanine.

name: Cyclamate
description: Artificial sweetener. Banned in some countries.

name: Saccharin
description: Artificial sweetener. Possible carcinogen in high doses.

name: Sucralose
description: Artificial sweetener. 600 times sweeter than sugar.

name: Steviol Glycosides
description: Natural sweetener from stevia plant. Generally safe.
